reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Food and Agricultural Products Classification Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Organic Certification Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 304/2016, September 1, 2018]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Food and Agricultural Products Classification Act;
certificate means a certificate issued under section 7 [issuing certificates];
certifying agency means an agency exercising a power or performing a duty of the administrator further to a delegation made under section 3 [administrator];
organic production standards means the standards adopted under section 9 (1) [duties on being certified];
organic program means the Organic Food and Agricultural Products Certification Program continued under section 2 [certification program continued];
organic protected label means a protected label prescribed under section 11 [protected labels with respect to certification] or 12 [protected labels with respect to organic nature];
produce means to possess, rear, grow, harvest, process, transport or store;
society means a society as defined in the Societies Act;
verification officer means a person described in section 6 [verification officers].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The program established under the Organic Agricultural Products Certification Regulation before its repeal

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is continued as a certification program for the purposes of the Act, and
is named the Organic Food and Agricultural Products Certification Program.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The purpose of the Organic Food and Agricultural Products Certification Program is to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: certify operators who meet organic production standards, and
enable certified operators to use organic protected labels.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia is authorized to continue as the administrator of the organic program.
The administrator is authorized to do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: exercise the powers and perform the duties described in section 4 (1) (a) to (c) of the Act;
collect and retain fees

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of exercising the powers and performing the duties described in section 4 (1) (a) to (c) of the Act, and
as described in section 4 (1) (d) (i) to (iii) of the Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate to one or more certifying agencies one or more of the powers and duties described in paragraphs (a) and (b) of this subsection;
delegate to one or more committees of the administrator one or more powers with respect to the administration of the organic program.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator must not collect, or permit a certifying agency to collect, a fee except as permitted under the Schedule.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia must do all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: admit as members those societies who meet the Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia's requirements for membership;
admit as a non-voting member a person designated by the minister;
audit its voting members to ensure continued compliance with the Act and requirements for membership;
suspend or cancel the membership of voting members who do not comply with the Act or requirements for membership;
subject to section 8 [appeals of decisions], have a fair process for determining appeals respecting the refusal, suspension or cancellation of membership.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator may delegate its powers and duties only to certifying agencies that meet all of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certifying agency must be a society;
the certifying agency must be a voting member, in good standing, of the Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia;
at least some of the members of the certifying agency must be engaged in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: producing food or agricultural products according to organic production standards, or
distributing or marketing food or agricultural products that have been produced according to organic production standards;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certifying agency must engage one or more verification officers, and each verification officer must meet the requirements of section 6 [verification officers];
the administrator must be satisfied that the certifying agency

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: can effectively carry out the delegated powers and duties, including ensuring that the members of the certifying agency are complying with organic production standards, and
has a fair process for determining appeals respecting the refusal or cancellation of membership in the society of the certifying agency.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 8 [appeals of decisions], the administrator may set standards for the purpose of subsection (1) (e) of this section.
A certifying agency must engage one or more verification officers for the purpose of ensuring that the members of the certifying agency

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: are complying with organic production standards, and
are using organic protected labels in accordance with the Act and this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A verification officer must be a member in good standing of the International Organic Inspectors Association.
The administrator

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may establish additional training and qualification requirements that verification officers must meet, and
must establish standards of practice that must be followed by verification officers.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A verification officer must comply with the requirements, if any, and standards set under subsection (3).
A person may apply to a certifying agency, in the form and manner required by the certifying agency, for a certificate.
A certifying agency may issue a certificate, with or without conditions, to an applicant if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant is a member in good standing of the certifying agency, and
the certifying agency is satisfied that the applicant

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: produces food or agricultural products according to organic production standards, or
distributes or markets food or agricultural products that have been produced according to organic production standards.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A certificate is proof that the certifying agency is satisfied of the matters set out in subsection (2) (b).
A certificate is valid for one year and is not transferable.
In this section, "decision" means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a decision of the administrator to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: refuse an application for membership in the Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia, or
suspend or cancel membership in the Certified Organic Associations of British Columbia;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a decision of the administrator or a certifying agency to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: refuse an application for a certificate,
attach conditions to a certificate, or
suspend or cancel a certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On making a decision, the decision maker must give written notice of the decision to the applicant, member or certificate holder, and the reasons for it.
A person who receives notice of a decision may appeal the decision by submitting a notice of appeal to the decision maker.
A notice of appeal

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may be sent no later than 30 days after receiving the notice of decision, and
must be in the form and manner required by the decision maker.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receiving a notice of appeal, the decision maker must give to the appellant a written notice of hearing.
A notice of hearing must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be sent no later than 30 days after receiving the notice of appeal, and
include the date, time and place of the hearing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The standards of the administrator set out in the publication entitled "British Columbia Certified Organic Production Operation Policies and Management Standards" are adopted for the purposes of this regulation as organic production standards.
An operator who holds a certificate must comply with the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all organic production standards that apply to the production of food or agricultural products by the operator;
the conditions, if any, attached to the operator's certificate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of determining fees payable under section 3 of the Schedule, an operator who holds a certificate must give to the certifying agency that issued the certificate receipts or other evidence, satisfactory to that certifying agency, of the operator's gross sales revenue within the meaning of that section.
An operator must give the receipts or other evidence referred to in subsection (3) to the certifying agency before the date specified, and in the manner required, by that certifying agency.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Protected labels with respect to certification

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are established as protected labels:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: "BC Certified Organic";
"British Columbia Certified Organic".

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The symbol established by the administrator in the publication entitled "British Columbia Certified Organic Program Symbol User's Guide" is adopted as a protected label.

A person must not take an action prohibited under section 9 of the Act with respect to a protected label referred to in subsection (1) or (2) of this section unless the food or agricultural product referred to in that section was produced, distributed or marketed by an operator holding a certificate and acting in compliance with organic production standards.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Protected labels with respect to organic nature

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The term "organic" is adopted as a protected label, including

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: other grammatical forms of that term,
phonetic representations of that term, and
abbreviations and symbols for that term.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not take an action prohibited under section 9 of the Act with respect to a protected label referred to in subsection (1) of this section unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the food or agricultural product referred to in that section

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has been produced, distributed or marketed by an operator holding a certificate and acting in compliance with organic production standards, or
is certified in accordance with the Organic Products Regulations, 2009 (Canada), or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person acts in accordance with a permission given under subsection (3).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may permit a person, with or without conditions, to use a protected label described in subsection (1) if all of the following conditions are met:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister receives from the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an application in the form and manner required by the minister, and
the information the minister reasonably requires to evaluate the application;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister is satisfied that the food or agricultural product in connection with which the protected label is intended to be used will be produced, distributed or marketed according to standards that substantially achieve the public health, animal welfare and environmental protection goals reflected by organic production standards;
the minister is satisfied that the protected label will be used in a manner that does not mislead the public as to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the quality of the food or agricultural product in connection with which the protected label is intended to be used, relative to other food and agricultural products of the same type, or
the extent of independent verification or oversight, if any, of production methods used by the operator.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Schedule, "fiscal year" means the period beginning April 1 and ending March 31.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of exercising the powers and performing the duties described in section 4 (1) (a) to (c) of the Act, the administrator may collect and retain a fee that is no greater than $15 000 per operator per year.

If the administrator delegates to a certifying agency the power to collect and retain a fee in relation to the exercise of a power or the performance of a duty described in section 4 (1) (a), (b) or (c) of the Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certifying agency may not, except with the written approval of the administrator, use a method of calculating the amount of the fee that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: includes the exercise of discretion by that certifying agency, and
causes, or may cause, the amount to be different for different members of that certifying agency, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the administrator must not give approval for the purpose of paragraph (a) unless satisfied that the certifying agency has a fair process for determining appeals respecting the amount of the fee payable by members.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, "gross sales revenue" means the gross sales revenue received by an operator during the preceding fiscal year in return for the distribution of food and agricultural products produced by the operator.
